alert.note: Alert for Central Chelan County; Western Chelan County (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 5:08PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Chelan County through 545 PM PDT... At 507 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles northeast of Merrit, or 24 miles northeast of Stevens Pass, moving southwest at 25 mph. HAZARD...Penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Chumstick, Merrit, Telma, Plain, Fox Creek Campground, Winton, Tumwater Campground, Lake Wenatchee Campground, White Pine Campground, and Grouse Creek Campground. This includes U.S. Highway 2 in Washington between mile markers 73 and 90. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Central Chelan County; Western Chelan County
